subject:
Re: [R] the biggest integer R can display in complete form but not
 scientific form
body:
\u674e\u4fca\u6770 wrote:> Dear R-lister,> > One of my friends wanted to produce random number which is 64 bits. He did> it with Fortune. I think R can do it also. But I don't know how to display a> very big integer in the complete form but not scientific form. And what's> the biggest integer R can display in complete form ?> > Thanks in advance,> > Li Junjie> > > I guess the biggest integer R can represent (if this is what you mean) is machine dependent and you can find it out via:
.Machinehelp(".Machine")
I hope this helps,Roland
______________________________________________R-help@stat.math.ethz.ch mailing listhttps://stat.ethz.ch/mailman/listinfo/r-helpPLEASE do read the posting guide http://www.R-project.org/posting-guide.htmland provide commented, minimal, self-contained, reproducible code.
